etymology.description: phonetic 林(林) (lín, "forest") + semantic 示(示) (shì, "altar") = related to controlling sacred or ritualistic spaces -> forbid
etymology.interpretation: The integration of 林(林) (lín, "forest") as a phonetic component with 示(示) (shì, "altar") indicates a connection to restricting or regulating spaces, especially those of religious significance, which conceptually aligns with the idea of 'forbidding.'

examples.chinese: 政府禁止在公园内吸烟(政府禁止在公園內吸煙)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ jìnzhǐ zài gōngyuán nèi xīyān.
examples.english: The government forbids smoking in the park.

examples.chinese: 学校禁止携带食品(學校禁止攜帶食品)。
学校禁止带入手机(學校禁止帶入手機)，违反者将受到处分(違反者將受到處分)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxiào jìnzhǐ dàirù shǒujī, wéifǎn zhě jiāng shòudào chǔfèn.
examples.english: The school forbids bringing mobile phones, and violators will be penalized.
